sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base length of 8cm and a base width of 5cm. The height of the pyramid is 10cm. What is the volume of the rectangular pyramid?
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid can be found by multiplying the base length and base width:

Base Area = Base Length × Base Width
Base Area = 8 cm × 5 cm
Base Area = 40 cm²

Now, we can find the volume of the pyramid:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height
Volume = (1/3) × 40 cm² × 10 cm
Volume = (1/3) × 400 cm³
Volume = 133.33 cm³ (rounded to two decimal places)

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is approximately 133.33 cm³.
